main event: On February 11th, 1949, a witness observed a dull red ball of fire in the sky near Curling East, Newfoundland.
interesting points: The object appeared circular at first, then it faded and flamed out, resembling a blowtorch flame., The witness described the object as being about the size of the morning sun when it first appeared., A bus driver also claimed to have seen the object at the same time., The incident was reported to the police following the sighting., Photographs were taken at the observation site, though quality may be poor.
sighted object: a dull red ball of fire
witness description: One witness was a paper finisher, considered reliable by local authorities; the other witness is not identified.
